amendment.description: Amendment sought to change the definition of exempted regulations from those relating to the existence of any condition reasonably expected to cause "death, serious illness or severe injury..." to any condition reasonably expected to cause substantial endangerment" to humans or private property.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (printed as amendment No. 36 in the Congressional Record of February 22, 1995) to change the definition of exempted regulations from those relating to the existence of any condition reasonably expected to cause "death, serious illness or severe injury..." to any condition reasonably expected to cause substantial endangerment" to humans or private property.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Waxman amendment (A006) Failed by recorded vote: 167 - 259 (Roll no. 163).
